title: 2 Ways to Change the Voice on Google Maps

steps.title: Tap your profile icon in Google Maps.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon in Google Maps. It's in the top left corner of the Maps app. Luckily, Android's version of Google Maps easily allows you to change the voice . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is near the bottom of the menu next to an icon of a gear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Navigation Settings.
steps.content: Tap Navigation Settings . You'll probably need to scroll down to find this option near the bottom of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Voice selection.
steps.content: Tap Voice selection . This is below the "Guidance volume" section and will open a new window. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select a voice.
steps.content: Select a voice. The suggested voices won't change your experience too much and are region-specific, meaning that language will use terminology that other regions don't. For example, English (US) and English (UK) both speak English, but in different accents and with different terms. [5] X Research source Tap Play test sound to preview the voice.

steps.title: Get more voice options with Google Assistant.
steps.content: Get more voice options with Google Assistant. You can further customize the voice with Google Assistant , like changing the gender from female to male. If you choose a different voice in Google Assistant, you'll hear that voice in Maps as long as your Maps voice is set to "Default." To change that voice: Open Assistant and tap your profile picture. Tap Assistant voice & sounds , then tap the color associated with the voice that you like. Once you choose a new voice, close both apps. Then, open Google Maps to make sure "Default (English)" is selected. The voice you selected in Assistant will now play in Maps!

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings. If you want to hear a different language or accent in Google Maps, you'll have to change the language on your iPhone or iPad. If you don't mind switching your language settings for all of your apps, open your Settings now. [6] X Research source Unfortunately, the Google Maps app does not allow you to change your voice on your iPhone or iPad unless you change your language or region. If you want more voice options for navigation, you might want to use Apple Maps instead. Apple Maps uses Siri to guide you, and you can easily change Siri's voice . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . It's in the third grouping of options next to an icon of a gear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Langauge & Region.
steps.content: Tap Langauge & Region . You'll see this near the bottom of the menu. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap iPhone Language.
steps.content: Tap iPhone Language . This will open a new window with a list of languages.

steps.title: Tap a language.
steps.content: Tap a language. After you tap Done and confirm the change, your phone will change to reflect this new language selection. Not only will your entire phone display the new language, but your other apps could as well (if they have language settings), including Google Maps.
